column4: heres what happened: 1) ran updates, 2) added repos for "ubuntu tweak", 3) did apt-get update | upgrade -- got errors, 3) googled, googled, googled -- 4) removed "ubuntu tweak" repos from etc/apt/sources.list, 5) tried installing additional software / updates -- problem persisted -- 6) removed 822.pm, 7) problem worse, 8) asked for 822.pm from group -- pastebin, 9) saved in location //usr/share/perl5/Debconf/Format/822.pm, 10) s
udo chown root:root 822.pm -- 11) tried to run updates again -- same error
10) sudo chown root:root 822.pm -- 11) tried to run updates again -- same error
well -- sortof -- i have installed programs from Add/Remove... under "Applications" but otherwise yes
sudo rm 822.pm
sudo rm 822.pm
to see what would happen
doesn't matter; problem same as before
yes
if it would detect it was missing and try and fox
you could've just moved it :-)
what's the deal with the kernel version spam?
what?
well, i was just curious why you were asking folks if they were running a specific kernel. it seemed kind of random.
and reinstalling the relevant kernel package is not an option?
reinstalling the package, friend, not the entire system :-)
-- the problem is my package-manager -- its broken
heh, that's unfortunate. how'd that happen?
what file are you missing?
you could steal it from the package
no need to install it, merely unpack the archive
well, what error are you getting?
why not simply grab debconf, extract the archive manually, and install the relevant files by hand?
